page.title: 17THE ECOLOGY OF HEDON
page.content: {Hedon}is a small market town surrounded by farmland.This is mainly used for arable farming.The fields are seperated by hedgerows and ditches which provide a sheltered habitat for a great variety of insects,plants, small mammals and birds. The foreshore and mudbanks along the banks of the River Humber near{Paull} provide a different habitat used by wading birds and small invertebrates. There are also a number of small ponds providing a refuge for small fish and amphibians including newts. There are many interesting footpaths and bridleways passing through the countryside which enable people to enjoy the sights and wildlife of the area. Pollution is a problem in the River Humber and the various ditches and small ponds in the area.
